messages.subject: Columbus, OH Unschooling groups
messages.msgSnippet: Thank you, Marjorie. It s reassuring to hear there s a lot of other unschoolers here, since we haven t met any yet. (We ve been here in Ohio only a couple of
messages.messageBody:
Thank you, Marjorie. It's reassuring to hear there's a lot of other
unschoolers here, since we haven't met any yet. (We've been here in Ohio only
a couple of years.) I've heard of HECLC, but I seem to hear about meetings
after they happen, instead of before. I thought I was on an e-mail list for
them, but I think I'm trying to go in so many directions at once I can't seem
to follow up anything completely. I'll keep the 23rd free!

Also - what is the "old Resource Center"?

Thanks.

Linda

In a message dated 1/4/03 11:56:18 AM Eastern Standard Time, "Marjorie Kirk" <
mkirk@...> writes:
>
> As far as I know, there aren't any official unschooling groups in town, but
> there are a lot of unschoolers. There also used to be a playgroup at the
> old Resource Center for families with young children, but i don't know if
> it
> still in existance or not. I would recommend attending a meeting or two to
> see who you could hook up with.
>
> Marjorie
>
> Are you familiar with HECLC? It's a group trying to start a new Resource
> Center in Columbus. Our next meeting is Thursday the 23rd at the
> Worthington Library.
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
